thread.title: Jaganmohan Reddy's health declines as his indefinite fast enters day 5 | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: Jaganmohan Reddy's health declines as his indefinite fast enters day 5 | Deccan Chronicle

author: PTI
title: Jaganmohan Reddy's health declines as his indefinite fast enters day 5 | Deccan Chronicle
text:
PTI | October 11, 2015, 17.45 pm YSRCP president YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on the 2nd day of his indefinite fast demanding special status to Andhra Pradesh at Guntur (Photo: PTI/File) Guntur: YSR Congress president Jaganmohan Reddy's indefinite fast in support of Special Status for Andhra Pradesh on Sunday entered the fifth day even as his health deteriorated.
A team of government doctors visited Jagan at the hunger strike camp at Nallapadu village in the district at around 11 AM on Sunday for his health checkup.
The leader's mother YS Vijayamma and his wife Bharathi also arrived at the camp to lend support.
Briefing on Jagan's health, doctors said he was getting weak day by day and has lost 2 kgs in the last five days.
His pulse rate has also come down, doctors said, adding that they also carried out blood and other tests at the spot.
Meanwhile, YSRCP leader Botsa Satyanarayana said party workers are worried about Jagan's health but their leader is firm on his stand to continue with the hunger strike.
He said the 'Special Status' is like "sanjeevani" (medicine) which will offer a new lease of life to AP.
The former minister also expressed confidence that Prime Minister Narendra Modi might announce Special Status for the state on visit for the foundation stone-laying ceremony of the new capital city, Amaravathi, on October 22.
States: Andhra Pradesh Jaganmohan Reddy indefinite fast AP Special status Also Read Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker reprimands 'dictatorial' Jagan for pushing agenda Andhra Pradesh wants to be special for 15 years Jagan Reddy refuses to attend Chandrababu Naidu's 'grand' swearing-in Congress MPs demand special status for Andhra Pradesh
